website_summaries.verdict: This top-notch emergency radio is a great choice for camping trips and other outdoor excursions.
pros: Includes a handle and reading lamp for added convenience
Offers instant access to AM and FM stations, as well as weather channels
Enables you to set up an alarm so that you can be automatically notified about natural disasters and other emergencies
Can serve as a power bank for a variety of mobile devices
cons: Reception may be fuzzy at times
Tuning knob may come off the radio on its own

customer_reviews.title: Nice radio nice features nice price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice radio, especially for only $30. It has good sound and seems to be well-made and works well. I only have one complaint and that is: there is no power source selection switch. It apparently chooses on his own where the power is coming from. So if you have the rechargeable battery and alkaline batteries installed, you don't really know which one is powering the radio at any given time. Still, I can say that I can recommend this product to anyone who is considering it.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Bob

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to be pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: For its size it sounds great! Everything works out of the box. Flashlight is bright. Reading panel supplies enough light to read by or to work hands free on a project in an emergency. Solar cells provide plenty of power to recharge the battery. Like another reviewer said I don't think it will survive a lot of rough handling. I was extremely surprised by how clear the NOAA channels sound. FM is great, AM not so much. A serious SW buff will be disappointed; you need digital tuning to really zero in on certain frequencies, but for the price I can highly recommend this radio. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: D. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't expecting to love this little radio so much - considering the price ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting to love this little radio so much - considering the price - but I do. In light of the mudslides that have devastated our local area here in CA, I have been motivated to finish my emergency kit. The radio is the perfect size. While I have not used the solar component, I did try out the crank and all the features (radio, light, lantern, and siren.) I ordered a second one to be sent to my 80+ year old aunt, and she is also impressed. It is easy for her to operate and the radio reception is clear.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Reception was very poor only picked up one station while camping
customer_reviews.text: volume knob was broken off when I opened the box. Reception was very poor only picked up one station while camping. Cranking it to provide a charge for the battery was a joke unless you want to crank it all day,would have returned it but thw window to return it closed before we got back from camping as we stayed 47 days. Save your money and get something better.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Smith

customer_reviews.title: Advertised functions work well
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't actually used it extensively or in an emergency situation, I can definitely speak well of it - it was fine after being in the below-freezing temperatures for hours on my doorstep, and all the advertised functions seem to work very nicely. It came pre-charged, so I couldn't test how much radio or light time you get for each minute of cranking the dynamo, but it seemed to do well when I tried removing the lithium ion battery and cranking.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the videos.
customer_reviews.text: I either received a very defective machine or the YouTube videos were bogus. There is no such thing as pulling this radio out of the box and getting your needs met. I thought that my issues were due to the item being uncharged, but that was not the case. Even after charging through electricity and adding batteries I could not even get static. The lights worked, but I already have flashlights. I purchased this item because it has NOAA, radio, and charging for cell phone etc. After reading the instructions multiple times, my husband and I still could not get this product to work. It was sent back and money reimbursed.
customer_reviews.author: MonaLisa

customer_reviews.title: Not workable as an NOAA emergency alert. Otherwise ok.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine...except you cannot mute the weekly NOAA test, and after the test the radio stays on until you shut it off. So if you are not home, you will come home to a radio playing the weather station. Also, you cannot filter alerts, so you will get a very loud siren for all kinds of alerts. Not workable as an alert radio for these reasons. Otherwise the features are good and work as described.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Torgeson

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: The tuning knob fell off immediately. After a few uses the antenna fell off. I wouldn't want to have to rely on this radio in the event of an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Trixieann

customer_reviews.title: Like features, but no simple way to mute NOAA message
customer_reviews.text: I like being able to power my cellphone from the radio. It receives NOAA weather radio very well. Light is very usable. When NOAA weather radio sends out a message, the radio sets off a siren followed by the NOAA message. I have not figured out a simple way to mute the message and have it go back to standby mode. Many NOAA messages do not pertain to my specific location and I would like to be able to go back to sleep quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Luna's Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Not any good for NOAA weather or SW1, SW2
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio specifically to get the NOAA weather. I live in Summerville, SC. This radio does not receive any NOAA weather broadcasts. It also doesn't receive any SW broadcasts. And there isn't any 800 number to call to contact the manufacturer. This was a total waste of money. Would not recommend anyone buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Charlesworth

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and poorly made
customer_reviews.text: The display for the radio fell off before I got it. It is the cheapest worst manufactured item I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbielackovic

customer_reviews.title: Not just an average radio!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio for power outages. One reason I decided on this particular radio was because of the various ways to charge it. Hand crank... Works great, rechargeable... It is...and it also uses regular batteries. Can also be used as a power bank for cell phones etc. As an extra... You can also use it to play music from an sd card! I have no problems with getting radio stations either. Did I mention it also charges by solar? It does!! I am very happy with my new radio!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a week.  Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sounding radio, but after a couple of days the Power/Volume knob came loose, and now just spins freely and rattles. If you press on the knob, it'll function, but just turning the knob does nothing. Charging the onboard 'rechargable' overnight yielded about 5-10 minutes of run time, so the radio seemingly needs AA batteries for any extended operation. There is also no way to manually switch between the AA batteries and the Rechargeable battery. Decent sound, but poor build quality and its heavy dependency on AA batteries make this radio pointless as an emergency radio.
customer_reviews.author: M G M Jr

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I thought it would be a good multi-use item for our emergency plan due to the frequent power outages due to severe fire weather here in California. We have had three outages in the last several weeks....which I can't complain about because PG&E doesn't want another loss of an entire town like Paradise last year. However, this radio is just garbage. Reception is poor, if at all. I have replaced batteries to no avail. I will not buy such an important item for us over the internet again. The only thing that was helpful was a light so I could read at night when we've had no power, but the radio is junk!!!
customer_reviews.author: Trail Rider

customer_reviews.title: Poor value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I had researched a number of these type of emergency radios with NOAA/Weather channel. I got this one because it looked 'sturdier' then the others and the cost was more. I thought the extra dollars would translate to better value. Boy was I wrong. It is very cheaply made. I couldn't get basic reception on the stations I would use in emergency both in/outside. It was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Very good backup plan for Florida
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we expected. Living in Florida, you need a backup plan, and this is part of ours. It has a USB port for charging all sorts of devices, a radio with different bands, so you can pick up just about anything you might need to hear: local news, NOAA, etc... The light on the side is a nice bonus too. Love that it has different ways to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Kosky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Radio and Features!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice radio!! The sound is amazing very good tone quality, Reception on all bands is good, For the shortwave listeners out there, sensitivity is good. I would use a clip on Antenna when necessary, I believe this radio has step tuning, Which means you tune the radio signals slowly. It’s not like traditional analog tuning. The lamp light and flashlight works great. Over all a amazing radio for the price.
customer_reviews.author: shai will

customer_reviews.title: iRonsnow responds quickly to any requests,
customer_reviews.text: Your radio really, for the cost, surprised me. It has many more features than I needed or expected, and they all seem to work just fine. The only thing that should be improved is the operating instructions for all the features, they are a little limited. Again thank you Gary
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have an Eton radio that has worked excellent for years, but wanted a 2nd device and tried to avoid paying $99 for the Eton. This device seemed like a good value and I found it ranked 3rd on an independent web ranking of weather radios. After receiving the product in the mail, I installed batteries and cranked it up. The light and siren functions functioned properly, however none of the radio functions worked at all included weather band. No signal or even noise of any kind on any setting. I'm returning this one and buying a Midland branded radio instead for $10 more. If I have any issues at all, I'll just fork out the $$$ for Eton.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice radio!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easily removable 18650 battery and ability to use AA batteries (3). Clear reception Decent flashlight (more like a spotlight...not very diffused) Reading lamp Siren FM/AM/Shortwave/NOAA/NOAA Alerts MicroSD card for music Cons: Sketchy build quality (knobs/reading light especially) No water proof/resistance Other thoughts: The 18650 was in a blue plastic jacket...couldn't tell mfr/model/capacity for sure MicroSD card reportedly only plays music from root of the card...no frills music player. I've dropped the radio once and the tuning mob popped off...thankfully it just snapped right back on. Reading light feels like it would break off if it was open and the radio fell.
customer_reviews.author: Ishi Carter

customer_reviews.title: multiple charging options
customer_reviews.text: Out of the gate very pleased with shipping time and packaging. Arrived in great shape. I took it out and started messing around with it. I noticed a few things. There are 3 different battery options as well as the hand crank. For me, that's a big plus. NIce to have multiple options. It is both light and sturdy. I haven't been able to test the solar yet but it appears to be rugged enough to handle it. I'm sending one of these to my son in college.
customer_reviews.author: EricD

customer_reviews.title: A portable weather radio that works in a country valley!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend the iRonsnow IS-388 Weather Radio! We have used the weather alert several times this Spring to get up to the minute weather before and during storms. I use it in our sun room, and it stays continuously charged due to the built-in solar panel. I only had to plug it in once to charge the included battery. The limited radio stations are mostly clear in our country valley.
customer_reviews.author: graywolf

customer_reviews.title: Too Fragile
customer_reviews.text: There is no way this will hold up in an emergency situation. We highly doubt it would survive a small drop. It is super flimsy. Also, our SD slot was cut all crooked and no way would a card fit in the slot. We returned it and continued our search for the perfect emergency radio... Pro: The radio sound quality is not bad. Con: It is too flimsy for an emergency situation. The hand crank feels like it will snap and the handle is also quite fragile. The black part of the radio is made of that plastic that eventually turns "sticky".
customer_reviews.author: KevinTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Cute compact all in one emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: Love this cute compact all in one emergency radio. It has numerous important capabilities with easy directions. Solar, battery, and crank powered for emergencies without electricity. Bright flashlight, and super bright reading lamp, along with the charge functions for my cell are very important uses during a hurricane living along the coast. There is an emergency siren for those OMG hope these never happen moments. The numerous bands on the FM, AM, and NOAA weather stations will be vital in providing information needed. I will be purchasing another of these radios for my Grandson's use at his coastal home as well.
customer_reviews.author: beach mambo

customer_reviews.title: Good product,  BAD MANUAL !
customer_reviews.text: The product is worth the money. Nice features, the quality is not great but good enough for the price. To bad the instruction manual is so poorly written. No information on the hand crank or how to charge your phone thru the USB out. It's like a google translation gone wrong. Now there is 1 clear issue, there is no power switch option to choose between the rechargeable battery or the 3 AA batteries. So your never gonna know what power source is being used. The Device is 5 stars but had to take 1 star away for the poor lazy manual. Over all happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LifeIsAwesome90

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I like the carry handle. The radio works well. The reading light is bright enough to light up a room. The spot light is bright, but has more of a halo look to it. I prefer the reading light over that one. I really like that I can initially charge it with my computer or plugged in, and then store it. The crank charging is easy to use, and charges pretty quickly. I haven't really had it long enough to assess the battery life in storage, but it is still charged after several days of initially charging it and playing with it. All in all, I think it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jansatech

customer_reviews.title: Its analog tuner is good, it locks in most of the nearby stations ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my previous $80 dollar top brand-name emergency radio and I was pleasantly surprised with this radio and its many thoughtful features (e.g., lamp, flashlight, etc). Its analog tuner is good, it locks in most of the nearby stations but there is a little electronic zoom noise at lower volume levels. It has good speakers which are loud at the lowest level but that works for my purpose. I wished it was smaller (about) half its size) -- then it will be perfect/easier to pack on a backpack for my purposes. I have had it for a week and it works fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: NELSON R MANOHAR

customer_reviews.title: Love it 5/5
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's one of the better products out there. This is NOT a high-end radio. If that's what you're looking for, there are products that range from $100-$200. But...for the price, it is great. Sound is good. Reception is good. Battery life is great. I actually used the radio during the Dorian Hurricane. The only thing I wish it had was a clock. Other than that, it meets my needs. I had to contact the company about a new part, they responded immediately. They had great customer service! I would buy this again. -MrNetTek
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Jackson (MrNetTek)

customer_reviews.title: Excellent NOAA Weather Radio!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent NOAA Weather Radio! My kids love listening to NOAA weather and they had been asking me to get them a small radio. I am very happy with this purchase. It comes with a light, a flashlight, AM FM radio, NOAA weather, and you can charge it either via USB or by leaving it in the sun. This is perfect for the kids, they love it, and it's awesome to take with you pretty much anywhere you go: on the beach, fishing, hiking, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Love2cook

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind Radio!
customer_reviews.text: With the summer storms outside, it's comforting to have this radio handy when I'm at the campsite! You can't always get TV reception, so knowing what's developing is important! The various power options is awesome! I have a NOAA radio at home and on the RV!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: Just got, but seems to work great
customer_reviews.text: I was not pleased at first as It arrived uncharged and did not include the promised micro USB cable. But I had a micro USB cable for another device, charged it up, and was pleased at the sound quality of my local NOAA channel. I live in tornado territory, so NOAA and cranking were my 2 major reasons for buying. Lots of features for the price and it is now in my "safe space".. Hope it holds up!
customer_reviews.author: Oldfrat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent utility radio and weather alert!
customer_reviews.text: This radio is a MUST for all homes! It is lightweight and allows for battery, AC, or solar power. It pulled in all local stations and advised us of inclement weather on our last tent camping trip. It's full of neat features at a very fair price. It is sturdy and compact. We liked it so much we gave our sons one each as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Suzyzzle

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It does not give you very good reception or very good alerts
customer_reviews.author: Jim K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: This emergency radio has everything! It not only has all radio frequencies, including NOAA and other emergency frequencies as well as regular AM and FM, but also a flashlight and a reading light. It also can be charged by a hand crank, by solar, or by plugging in. It has other features as well, and is a convenient smaller size. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: N Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This product is a little gem of packed useful features it even amazed my wife... Everything works perfectly, all features nicely laid out thoughtfully. I'm very pleased with the quality (after a bitter experience with a competitor item that I had to return). I have to make sure my grand kids do not find it as they showed a lot of interest in handling it. Jokes aside, this is excellent serious product product that you wan to have in your possession at the right time, although I like to use it around the house, backyard, etc. whenever I feel like.
customer_reviews.author: Texan GS

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio with Great Features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio as a replacement of a FreePlay radio that broke. This is a very useful radio all the great features the FreePlay didn’t have like the flashlight, reading light, Weather radio, short wave channels emergency siren, SD Card and the rechargeable lithium battery and AA battery options. Great radio at a nice price!
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Best NOAA Alert Radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio does everything you need prior to and during a storm. It has two power sources, a solar panel or add batteries to power the radio and light. It also has a good speaker. It's gives complete directions and infomation on how to use. This product was well thought out in case of a storm or power outage. Glad I bought this NOAA alert radio
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This really has everything I was looking for- AM/FM/SW1/SW2/National Weather AND an MP3 player. All with the options to add batteries, use solar charging, as well as a crank to charge up the installed battery. All at a very reasonable price- I couldn't find anything that had all of this for such a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Frye

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: The radio is very light. It's almost like carrying air, so if you want to put this into a pack or kit, you can easily do that without too much weight, even if it would be bulky. The solar panel works: I put into a spot where it got daily direct sunlight for a few weeks and got a good hour of radio use out of it. The lights are bright: not tactical quality by any means, but can do in a pinch for a spotlight or emergency flashlight. The reading light is also conveniently placed for easy reading. I don't think it would hold up to a lot of rough usage, but for at-home use, it does just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Great Weather Radio!
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with this radio so far. Found the weather channel easily, it came in loud and clear. Love the fact that there are so many ways to keep it powered, solar, etc. We live in the country and always lose our tv service during storms. We don't do the cell phone thing, so we are always left guessing about the weather and that is not a good feeling here in 'Tornado Alley' . Radio feels sturdy, no loose knobs, etc. I feel much better now that I have this radio/lantern to keep me informed.
customer_reviews.author: Mama B

customer_reviews.title: NOAA Alert Weather Radio with the works
customer_reviews.text: Makes my old Red Cross weather radio (bought from Radio Shack) seem like a relic. The neatest thing to me is that I don't see how you could ever lose power between the Solar power aspect, the hand crank ability and AA battery back up. Sound quality was very good, the directions were super easy to follow and radio was great bang for the buck. This radio has SO many features that I can't recommend it highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: muddy waters

customer_reviews.title: Has ALERT for Weather Bands
customer_reviews.text: Nice little radio. Main reason I bought this one was start of Hurricane season and it has an ALERT for weather bands. (Not All do. We’ll also take RVing with us - Good for a wake up if tornado watches turn into warnings.) Decent sound, multiple power sources, can charge our phones, and super brite lights. Good price, light weight. Would’ve given 5 stars if there was a way to play my phone/music thru but only takes micro SD card.
customer_reviews.author: LCC

customer_reviews.title: The knobs keep coming off and the sound quality is bad. The emergency light works but the rest of ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is cheap for a reason. The knobs keep coming off and the sound quality is bad. The emergency light works but the rest of the product is not worth buying. Sorry. I kept it because I needed a radio quickly and it is the only one I have.
customer_reviews.author: SARA SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Does not play mp3s on my micro-sd card and ingoing connection for charging broke
customer_reviews.text: The device works fine with every thing else but the part that is suppose to play mp3s doesn't detect anything. Plus the manual doesn't explain if there is something specific you have to do to get the player to detect the music. I thought i'd update this review as the usb-b connection to the device that allows you to charge the battery has broken off and now makes this thing impossible to charge via USB input.
customer_reviews.author: Kain

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This arrived quickly and fortunately we have not had any outages,......but we are ready. This radio seems to do everything as advertised. Some features we have not tried yet. If you are looking for function in a nice package this should fit the bill. We have only tried the hand crank power so far and it works great. Stations are loud and clear. It is impressive. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Snow

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy to use this is. It gets very good reception and the light is bright. I think it's a must have for any home emergency kit. I'm glad i will have this on hand for any power outages or emergencies. I live in Michigan and the snow can leave us powerless for to long. I love that it will charge your devices as well. Also customer service is very nice, responsive and helpful if you have any problems. It's a must have for anyone wanting to be prepared
customer_reviews.author: Magoo

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because I live in hurricane prone areas and since I move to the beach I also worry about power outages. A recent tropical storm had me pulling it out to make sure it worked. I love the solar charging. Sat it up in the window and it fully charged. It ran well on the charge as well as the light and phone charge capability. Truthfully I hope I do not have to use anytime soon but nice to know this small weather radio seems to be a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Biya

customer_reviews.title: Fragile junk
customer_reviews.text: Only used this a few times. It’s basically a disposable radio. Handle broke off the bat. After a few uses the antenna snapped off. Tries to be a lot of things, but fails at it’s basic use, which is to be a functioning radio when you need it. On the upside it’s yet another inexpensive lesson to quit buying junk that is destined for the garbage from the moment you click “buy”.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Mcdermott

customer_reviews.title: Durable, good sound
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to use in a weather emergency yet, but everything functions well and has a useful purpose! Haven't had to change batteries yet, used off &on for last 3 months or so for music, sports on AM radio. Very sturdy, cat knocked off shelf onto concrete floor, nothing broke. Good reception from everywhere in our old farmhouse
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying!😀
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this radio for my mom and she liked it a lot ,very easy to use and sounds pretty laud .I really like that it has 2 different flashlights .When it arrived she open the box and test it out ,it worked great.All of the sudden it slipped off her hands and it fell really hard on my tile floor ...she screamed thinking it might of broke or would not be working ..and up to the day IT STILL WORKS.
customer_reviews.author: LIZ88

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one!
customer_reviews.text: This has so many features it is unbelievable. If you live in an area where you occasionally lose power, you will love this. You can charge by solar or hand crank and it has a place to charge your phone in addition to keeping you apprised of what is going on with the radio.
customer_reviews.author: Camera

customer_reviews.title: IF your looking for great service
customer_reviews.text: My mom was looking for a good camping radio for this upcoming camping season. We scrolled through our favorite online store amazon and Mom stopped on this product. She loved the options, size and versatility. I was in touch with the seller with questions on their fine product and they responded with the hour and followed up making sure we were satisfied customers. I highly recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn's Nana

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: This radio works very well and will be useful ina power outrage storm or other emergency. The radio is easy to use and the lights are very useful. everybody should have some sort of device like this at their home. I use it daily
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Edison

customer_reviews.title: Really good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little radio. Doesn't take up a lot of space, but the sound quality is surprisingly good for a small radio. The NOAA station and local stations came in loud and clear. We live in the country, about 10 miles from the nearest town, so reception is always a problem but not with this radio. So far, it is just running off the solar charge to the rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made crank handle.
customer_reviews.text: Cranking handle came apart the first time I tried it. As long as it runs by battery and/or solar charger, I guess it will be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J McVey

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for my Dad and he has been very happy so far
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Dad and he is very happy so far. It came very quickly and it was well packaged. This is the first time using a radio with many charging options. I got this brand because of the longer battery life as stated in the chart. You can also insert 3 x AA battery if you want but radio itself has a rechargeable battery so no need. Surprisingly, It has an sdcard slot to play your own music. He was able to get his favourite radio stations and clarity is great as well. Although, I wish I got him a black color.
customer_reviews.author: Yemmy

customer_reviews.title: Radio continiously cuts out
customer_reviews.text: This radio worked great, for about a week. Now the music constantly cuts in and out every 2 seconds it goes dead, comes back, cuts out again, over and over. Charged it completely with solar, it did the same thing, added fresh AA batteries, twice, no difference. Everything else seems to work fine, just not the radio. It isn't a signal problem because another radio next to it works just fine. It is this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Shayleia

customer_reviews.title: Weather radio..
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. Unit I received had a damaged radio tuner and a loose piece of broken plastic bouncing around inside...
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice weather radio
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice weather radio! We had tornado warning in the middle of the night and the alert worked as described! I would recommend this radio to all. I look forward to taking it fishing with me to use the micro card with my music instead of using my phone and a blue tooth speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Klingdog

customer_reviews.title: Good quality device in case of an emergency........
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to dislike about this product. I liked it so much that I bought two of them so I could have one at home and one in my travel trailer. I am not sure how good the charge handle is on the radio (it looks kind of flimsy) but every other part of the radio is great.....
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Instructions Inscrutable.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions seem to be written for someone already familiar with it. Also instructions written by someone who has difficulty with the English language. I will probably never figure out how to work this thing. I pray we don't get hit with a serious hurricane.
customer_reviews.author: James F. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Very clear reception
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this after my husband and I slept through a tornado (the weather alert on our iPhones didn’t go off). Came in today and I set it to the weather station using the included directions. Works great. Very clear reception. Also tried out the fm and got good reception. It is now sitting in a window sill behind a set of mini blinds where it can catch a charge for future use.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Fox

customer_reviews.title: Awesome weather alert & weather survival radio!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida and needed a good weather alert radio. This is more than that. The reception all all bands is excellent and the additional features are wonderful. Knowing that I have emergency lighting, solar and manual recharging and the ability to recharge my cell phone all in one place and tremendous advantages. I highly recommend this NOAA Alert Radio for all of my friends and neighbors! Thank you for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful device
customer_reviews.text: Really feel a lot better about Hurricane season with this device.. We were using the smaller NOAA device but it doesn't work out here in our area..This more powerful device does receive it... In a area closertotowns this woud be really amazing
customer_reviews.author: J.Lock

customer_reviews.title: Gift well-received!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a friend who is moving back to Uganda soon, so he can listen to AM - FM - Shortwave broadcasts back in his country even when power is not reliable. Shortwave is more common in the rest of the world. He was thrilled~!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made. Input jack failure after just a few months
customer_reviews.text: This radio got slightly better reception on the weather channel than a previous one we owned, so it was a keeper--for awhile. Unfortunately, the DC input jack broke loose and disappeared into the chassis about the fifth or sixth time we plugged into it. I have written to the company for a refund. I don't believe this unit is sturdy enough to be relied upon in an emergency and would not buy it again. Happy to update this review once I hear from the seller. We've owned the radio since last November--thus much less than a year--and we are just now getting around to contacting them. --SF
customer_reviews.author: Scott J. Fitzgerrell

customer_reviews.title: About one-fourth the price of similar emergency radios.
customer_reviews.text: This thing seems like it will do anything. It is one of the best weather radios I've heard. I went through and tried every function and they all worked fine. Not the top material construction so probably won't take a lot of beating around. Would like to have seen a small storage pocket to keep power cable in.
customer_reviews.author: Meckanism

customer_reviews.title: I like the size
customer_reviews.text: Received radio. I like the size. Tuning knob is hard to turn, but not like it's going to break. Went through all the switch selections to check out all radio and light functions. Good speaker. Don't have any music on a MP3 player, so couldn't check the SD card slot for working. Received without USB cable, but I had an extra one that worked perfectly and is probably better than what the factory cable is and why I didn't give it 5-stars. What surprised me and it's not mentioned is there's a charge light when plugged in. Has removable/replaceable 18650 battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jerre L. Roller

customer_reviews.title: Radio tries to do too much and fails.
customer_reviews.text: I love the simplicity and the charging features; but, trying to bring in radio signals is very difficult because of the small size. I'm going to get a more expensive digital radio where nearby stations do not bleed over.
customer_reviews.author: William Bryan

customer_reviews.title: ... a lot and all my old radios have seen better days. I ordered this after the last storm ...
customer_reviews.text: The power goes out here a lot and all my old radios have seen better days. I ordered this after the last storm and outage when my tried and true gave out.I like that it has all the power options and the flash in the same unit. I am thinking about getting anther one for my car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The volume knob broke after the 2nd use.
customer_reviews.text: I would be satisfied with the product for the price I paid if it had not broke after only the 2nd time I used it. The volume control knob will not turn off. So, the battery naturally drained quickly. It's always on when batteries are installed. I'm very disappointed because a NOAA radio is so important in the tornado zone where I live.
customer_reviews.author: Disappointed customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy that we have this.
customer_reviews.text: Since we now have planned power outages in our area, updated emergency equipment was needed. Solar charging is a great feature, but if there is too much smoke in the air it does not do the job so the option of using batteries was helpful. This one has a small reading light too... very useful. It is a great comfort to hear the radio when the rest of the electronic world has gone silent.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn R

customer_reviews.title: Huzzah
customer_reviews.text: The USB charging port was broken upon arrival. Seems like its a cool idea but not very well constructed. Returning and going to buy a different one. Update: Seller replacing radio
customer_reviews.author: CLB

customer_reviews.title: Complete fail
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio in Jan 2019. April 15, 2019 it starting losing connection intermittently with all radio stations. It loses connection every 30 seconds or so and only for a couple of seconds. At first I thought maybe there was an interruption with service in the area but my other radio does not have the same problem. I have tried charging it, replacing the batteries, and even moving it to another location but it continues with the intermittent loss of service. Do not waste your money on this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Tina M.

customer_reviews.title: Seems a good radio . . .
customer_reviews.text: I do not know if the NOAA stations are supposed to come with static in the background - which makes listening to it annoying. It make no difference if I'm listening to the NOAA station in the home, garage or outdoors!
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: This radio did not work when I received it and I have no option to return. I only learned this recently since I had bought it for emergencies only due to its NOAA capabilities and it's had crank. It doesn't do any good to hand crank it if the radio doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: poor switches
customer_reviews.text: I used this radio on a daily basis for many months and became very frustrated with it. The slider switch that changes frequencies from FM, AM, etc. became faulty and made it difficult to stay in a mode. I would have to tap the device to get it to click into the frequency. Also, the volume control knob didn't offer a smooth adjustment when turning the volume up or down. Further, the tuning knob is like operating a hair trigger. The slightest movement can change the channel. I wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wimberg family

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up !!
customer_reviews.text: This was great for the money and even bigger then I thought. I totally recommend this storm radio. I was just looking for something that would work and wasn’t so small I couldn’t see the dials, this works great for the money. Oh and the lights actually work really well and are practical. You will be happy with this deal.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Broke during first use.
customer_reviews.text: I took this out of my emergency kit to use for California’s planned power outages. It broke before I could even use it. I tried plugging in the adapter where devices are charged and the port broke, fell into the radio, and has been rattling there ever since. The product says it has a one year warranty. I will update this if I hear back from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Has a very loud speaker. It's the best radio I've ever had. I also have a smaller ironsnow unit, but this one is much better. Radio is more powerful, speaker is louder, and is easier to charge. This is a great asset to keep around in case of emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Radio for the price. Multiple power options and features.
customer_reviews.text: The Radio works out of the box, and seems like it will do the trick. I also like the fact it will operate on 3 AA batteries in the event of a prolonged outage. There's also a hand crank to power it as well. Tunes clearly, not extremely loud, but loud enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Portable radio
customer_reviews.text: It’s handy with necessary features. This is my first purchase of emergency radio so I have nothing to compare it with but I thought this is great with all the features you would need like the light and the charger.
customer_reviews.author: HD

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 months, then fell apart
customer_reviews.text: The knobs started falling off after 6 months and the antenna separated from the housing. It still "worked" but I wouldn't trust this thing in a long term emergency. Maybe it was damaged in shipping or just manufactured poorly. Reception was ok otherwise and crank worked.
customer_reviews.author: Firefly Bill

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product by mistake, the company was very easy to deal with on returning. Radio did seem to be well built & I believe this radio would preform very good. Again my mistake
customer_reviews.author: Charger

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I got this and about two days later the power went out. Was very useful when that happened as my phone was also almost dead and it helped to charge it and gave us light. Will be getting these for gifts in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Olive Ave

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Wife wanted this. Just opened today. I was pleasantly surprised. I'd like a clock and digital but she likes analog. Siren is cool but for what? Lights are great but reading light has restricted movement. Great overall equipment with many functions.
customer_reviews.author: sierraswitchbacks

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got this
customer_reviews.text: Charges well with the solar. The light is bright. Easy to find channels. The only thing it did not have that I really wanted was a headphone plugin. Other than that I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Maud Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, flexible charging, multiple features
customer_reviews.text: Terrific addition to the emergency kit. Very clear sound, many features, worked flawlessly right out of the box. Love that it can be battery operated, plugged in, and crank. Love the flashlight, clear sound and ability to charge other devices. During a storm, flexibility is very helfpul. This meets multiple needs as they arrive. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Templeton

customer_reviews.title: Sadly a worthless purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband and was a complete failure. As he took it out of the box, the front panel fell off. This past weekend he took it with him on a Boy Scout camping trip. A tuning button fell off and then it completely quit working. (This was it's first use.) It is now in the trash at Lake Livingston. He didn't even bother to bring it home. I'll stick to the Red Cross radio next time - we used that one for at least ten years.......
customer_reviews.author: Teri Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Smart emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio holds its charge, it has lots of great features. During power outage for several days, the solar charger gave me great comfort in knowing I would not be totally disconnected. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: broken USB port...cannot charge ahead of hurricane
customer_reviews.text: I have used this radio once, last year during a power outage from a hurricane in NC. Today I went to charge it as the hurricane is hitting NC tomorrow and there is something jiggling around inside. When I tried to connect the micro USB I realized what is jiggling around is the USB port itself. Can this be repaired? It has been stored and not used since last fall.
customer_reviews.author: MN-NICE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have it ready for use and I hope I'll never have to use it. I will change the batteries every other year just to make sure the product works if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: That it is available for important information should we ever need it.
customer_reviews.text: This item is something every household should have. I like this radio very much. Wish it wasn’t all plastic and cheaply made. Im sure there is a reason. The volume knob doesn’t always work but with a wiggle here and there it connects. I really do like this radio. I plan to order another and hop it’s Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Chavez-Schmuck

customer_reviews.title: 5 star radio
customer_reviews.text: not just a regular run in the mill radio.... lots of little gadgets go along with it ... flash light , reading light , charging station, emergency alarm..... can't be beat for the money spent... liked it so much I bought my sister one also
customer_reviews.author: ClingStoneAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wanted this if I loss power after a storm.
customer_reviews.text: The battery after full charged last maybe an hour, even sitting in the sun. So I don't know how I would use this if the power was out for any length of time, guess I won't. I would not recommend this radio, your better off buying lots of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Nature Girl

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice radio & sound quality is far better than expected
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because spring & summer storms will be upon us in a few months. This is a nice radio & sound quality is far better than expected. So when the TV goes out this will be a reliable source to keep us informed of weather conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Triggs

customer_reviews.title: Good gift!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my daughter who recently moved to LA. I was worried about earthquakes. She was not. Lol. She ended up really liking the radio and was thankful to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Quite working after about 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a radio that was dependable and played music. From the moment I started using it I had my doubts it was going to fulfill my wishes. The tuning mechanism was poor and I had difficulty finding and keeping a station. My doubts were realized last week when it just suddenly stopped working. It supposedly has a solar charger and also had a fresh set of batteries. Just stopped functioning and now will become just another piece of my outbound garbage. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Dudley Reiser

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I really am thrilled with the radio's I have purchased. I loved my first one so much that I purchased 3 more, all for gifts. The sound is amazing, and the ability to pickup stations is very good. Was worried about the quality, for the price, but it seems to be holding up well. Haven't tried the solar, nor the crank yet, but am sure it will be fine. Thank you for producing such an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D. in Missouri.

customer_reviews.title: Weak receptiom
customer_reviews.text: The AM & FM stations are on top of each other. Bunched to close to on another and can't receive the station I want. The weather station seems to works ok
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

product_meta.title: Real NOAA Alert Weather Radio with Alarm, iRonsnow IS-388 Solar Hand Crank Emergency AM/FM/SW/WB Radio, TF Card Speaker, LED Flashlight & Reading Camping Lamp, 2300mAh Cell Phone Charger
product_meta.description:
A REAL weather radio should have automatic NOAA alarm. 


NOAA alert alarm function working time: about 50 hours while full changed. It is one more choice to know the hazardous weather.
feature_bullets: 1. Real NOAA Alert Weather Radio: Automatically activate the alarm to inform you of any disaster weather conditions or warnings, when the radio is set at the “Alert” mode. It is a faster method to get warning from radio.
2. Wide range of reception: AM/FM/SW1/SW2/7 NOAA Weather channels, enough to receives any news including flood, tornado, thunderstorm, and other warnings
3. Better entertainment: Support Micro SD card (excluded) work as a MP3 Player, and too many channels to listen. Idea for home, bedroom, car, truck, camping, hiking, patio and garden.
4. Siren and Comfortable: Loud Siren; Convenient handle and reading lamp, Bigger size 7.8*5.1*2.6 inch (20*13*6.7cm).

5. High capacity: 2300mAh power bank for iPhone XR Max / X / 8 / 8 Plus / 7 / 7 Plus / 6 / 6 Plus / 5s (iPhone cable not included) . Can be charged by micro usb port, hand crank and solar panel. Support BACKUP 3 x AA battery (excluded). It is used as a Weather radio, can't work as a professional solar power bank.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars697 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
